verses.kjv: The word of the LORD which came unto Zephaniah the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hizkiah, in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah.
verses.ct: This is the message from the LORD that came to Zephaniah son of Cushi, son of Gedaliah, son of Amariah, son of Hizkiah, during the reign of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah.

verses.kjv: I will utterly consume all things from off the land, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "I will completely sweep away everything from the surface of the earth," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: I will consume man and beast; I will consume the fowls of the heaven, and the fishes of the sea, and the stumbling blocks with the wicked: and I will cut off man from off the land, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "I will sweep away people and animals. I will sweep away the birds of the heavens and the fish of the sea, and the idols that cause the wicked to stumble. I will wipe out humanity from the surface of the earth," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: I will also stretch out mine hand upon Judah, and upon all the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and I will cut off the remnant of Baal from this place, and the name of the Chemarims with the priests;
verses.ct: "I will stretch out my hand against Judah and against everyone living in Jerusalem. I will eliminate every trace of Baal worship from this place, along with the names of the pagan priests and the unfaithful priests.

verses.kjv: And them that worship the host of heaven upon the housetops; and them that worship and that swear by the LORD, and that swear by Malcham;
verses.ct: I will remove those who bow down on their rooftops to worship the stars, and those who claim to worship the LORD but also make oaths in the name of Malcham.

verses.kjv: And them that are turned back from the LORD; and those that have not sought the LORD, nor enquired for him.
verses.ct: I will remove those who have turned away from following the LORD, and those who have never sought the LORD or asked for his guidance."

verses.kjv: Hold thy peace at the presence of the Lord GOD: for the day of the LORD is at hand: for the LORD hath prepared a sacrifice, he hath bid his guests.
verses.ct: Be silent in the presence of the Lord GOD, because the day of the LORD is close. The LORD has prepared a sacrifice and has already invited his guests.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in the day of the LORD’s sacrifice, that I will punish the princes, and the king’s children, and all such as are clothed with strange apparel.
verses.ct: "On the day of the LORD's sacrifice, I will punish the officials, the royal family, and everyone who dresses in foreign clothing.

verses.kjv: In the same day also will I punish all those that leap on the threshold, which fill their masters’ houses with violence and deceit.
verses.ct: On that same day I will punish all who leap over the threshold, who fill their masters' houses with violence and fraud.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the LORD, that there shall be the noise of a cry from the fish gate, and an howling from the second, and a great crashing from the hills.
verses.ct: On that day," declares the LORD, "a cry of anguish will rise from the Fish Gate, wailing from the Second Quarter, and a tremendous crash from the hills.

verses.kjv: Howl, ye inhabitants of Maktesh, for all the merchant people are cut down; all they that bear silver are cut off.
verses.ct: Wail in grief, you who live in Maktesh, because all the merchants will be destroyed and everyone who trades in silver will be wiped out.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass at that time, that I will search Jerusalem with candles, and punish the men that are settled on their lees: that say in their heart, The LORD will not do good, neither will he do evil.
verses.ct: At that time I will search through Jerusalem with lamps and punish those who sit complacent, like wine left to thicken on its sediment — those who tell themselves, 'The LORD won't do anything, whether good or bad.'

verses.kjv: Therefore their goods shall become a booty, and their houses a desolation: they shall also build houses, but not inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, but not drink the wine thereof.
verses.ct: Their wealth will be plundered and their homes left in ruins. They will build houses but never live in them. They will plant vineyards but never drink the wine from them."

verses.kjv: The great day of the LORD is near, it is near, and hasteth greatly, even the voice of the day of the LORD: the mighty man shall cry there bitterly.
verses.ct: The great day of the LORD is near — near and approaching fast. The sound of the LORD's day is bitter; even the strongest warrior will scream in anguish.

verses.kjv: That day is a day of wrath, a day of trouble and distress, a day of wasteness and desolation, a day of darkness and gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness,
verses.ct: That day will be a day of fury, a day of trouble and agony, a day of ruin and devastation, a day of darkness and deep shadow, a day of clouds and dense blackness,

verses.kjv: A day of the trumpet and alarm against the fenced cities, and against the high towers.
verses.ct: a day of trumpet blasts and battle cries against the fortified cities and their tall corner towers.

verses.kjv: And I will bring distress upon men, that they shall walk like blind men, because they have sinned against the LORD: and their blood shall be poured out as dust, and their flesh as the dung.
verses.ct: "I will bring such distress on people that they will stumble around like the blind, because they have sinned against the LORD. Their blood will be poured out like dirt, and their bodies discarded like refuse.

verses.kjv: Neither their silver nor their gold shall be able to deliver them in the day of the LORD’s wrath; but the whole land shall be devoured by the fire of his jealousy: for he shall make even a speedy riddance of all them that dwell in the land.
verses.ct: Neither their silver nor their gold will be able to rescue them on the day of the LORD's fury. The entire land will be consumed by the fire of his jealousy, because he will bring sudden and total destruction on everyone living in the land."
